articles.headline: Home Depot Board Faces New Outcry
articles.snippet: Now that the board has ousted Home Depot’s chairman and chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, shareholders are expecting big changes at the home improvement retailing giant.
articles.abstract: Now that the board has ousted Home Depot’s chairman and chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, shareholders are expecting big changes at the home improvement retailing giant.
articles.lead_paragraph: Now that the board has ousted Home Depot’s chairman and chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, shareholders are expecting big changes at the home improvement retailing giant.

articles.headline: U.S. and Iraqis Hit Insurgents in All-Day Fight
articles.snippet: The battle in downtown Baghdad was one of the most dramatic operations in the capital since the invasion nearly four years ago.
articles.abstract: The battle in downtown Baghdad was one of the most dramatic operations in the capital since the invasion nearly four years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Jan. 9  More than 1,000 American and Iraqi troops, backed by Apache attack helicopters and fighter jets, battled insurgents all day Tuesday and late into the night in downtown Baghdad, in one of the most dramatic operations in the capital since the invasion nearly four years ago.

articles.headline: Big Three Look Back to Past Glories and Dream of Muscle
articles.snippet: Detroit automakers are trying to play up a distinct advantage over their Asian and European competitors - their design of the American muscle car.
articles.abstract: Detroit automakers are trying to play up a distinct advantage over their Asian and European competitors - their design of the American muscle car.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Jan. 9 — One of the Ford Motor Company’s showcase concept cars is the imposing Interceptor sedan, with its big wheels and a burly front end that suggests an armor-plated battering ram.

articles.headline: Venezuelan Plan Shakes Investors
articles.snippet: Investors reacted with alarm to a plan by President Hugo Chávez to nationalize crucial areas of the economy.
articles.abstract: Investors reacted with alarm to a plan by President Hugo Chávez to nationalize crucial areas of the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, Jan. 9 — Verizon Communications had been looking to lighten its exposure to Latin America for some time when it struck a deal in April to sell investments in three properties in Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic and Venezuela.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Congress to Take Up Net’s Future
articles.snippet: Senior lawmakers have begun drafting legislation that would prevent high-speed Internet companies from charging content providers for priority access.
articles.abstract: Senior lawmakers have begun drafting legislation that would prevent high-speed Internet companies from charging content providers for priority access.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 9  Senior lawmakers, emboldened by the recent restrictions on AT&T and the change in control of Congress, have begun drafting legislation that would prevent high-speed Internet companies from charging content providers for priority access.

articles.headline: The Future of Economics Is Not So Dismal
articles.snippet: Economists have been using their tools, mainly the analysis of enormous piles of data to tease out cause and effect, to examine everything from politics to French wine vintages.
articles.abstract: Economists have been using their tools, mainly the analysis of enormous piles of data to tease out cause and effect, to examine everything from politics to French wine vintages.

articles.headline: In Cingular-Apple Deal, Only Phone Was Missing
articles.snippet: With no prototype, the Cingular board’s approval of the partnership was an act of blind trust.
articles.abstract: With no prototype, the Cingular board’s approval of the partnership was an act of blind trust.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 — When Cingular executives went to the company’s board last year to get approval for a deal with Apple, they did so without so much as a prototype of an Apple phone to show the directors. The board signed off anyway.

articles.headline: Apple Introduces Innovative Cellphone
articles.snippet: Apple chose the name iPhone even though Cisco Systems had recently introduced a Wi-Fi-based phone with the same name.
articles.abstract: Apple chose the name iPhone even though Cisco Systems had recently introduced a Wi-Fi-based phone with the same name.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 9 — With characteristic showmanship, Steven P. Jobs introduced Apple’s long-awaited entry into the cellphone world Tuesday, pronouncing it an achievement on a par with the Macintosh and the iPod.
